data.title: Code Helper opens too many files when opening a project
data.body:
Upon opening a project, Code Helper opens an excessive number of files simultaneously. Checking `lsof -p ${pid}` output at a random point, it's reading over 4500 files, mostly in `vendor/bundler/**` (this is a Ruby project). On OSX, `kern.maxfiles` is set to 12,288 and `kern.maxfilesproc` to 10,240. At the point I was able to run `lsof`, I'm guessing Code Helper had already closed many of the files it had opened.

I've added this directory to files.watcherExclude, which I believed would exempt these files from this behavior, but is apparently not the case.

The specific process causing the problem:

```
/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/bootstrap --type=extensionHost
```


- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
gitignore|cod|0.5.0
githistory|don|0.2.2
proto|pet|0.0.2
Ruby|reb|0.12.1
RustyCode|sav|0.19.1
org-mode|too|0.1.3
gitblame|wad|2.0.2
better-align|wwm|1.1.6



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a project with hundreds of thousands of files spread throughout subdirectories. 
2. Open the project from the command line (`code .`).

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature Request: Column Guides
data.body:
I'm a long-time iOS developer, using VSCode to write React Native. I really enjoy Xcode's "page guide at column" feature, which (in my searching the web to see if I could solve this myself) seems to be called "column guides" in Visual Studio.

Here's what it looks like in Xcode:
![screen shot 2017-07-26 at 12 46 23 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/868389/28640416-7b1f936c-7200-11e7-95b9-72ccb67e9c7d.png)

If there's an existing setting for this, then I'd love to know so I can update the VSCode settings documentation to be more clear about it!

- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
python|don|0.6.9
flow-for-vscode|flo|0.7.1
python|tht|0.2.3
vscode-react-native|vsm|0.3.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Look for a column guide setting in VSCode.
2. Can't find one; search the web & StackOverflow.
3. Still can't find one; file a ticket on GitHub for the issue and cross your fingers! ❤️ 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Test: Debug API
data.body:
Test for #30338, #30157, #31266, and #31202:

Complexity: 3

- [x] any platform - **@jrieken**

Write a simple extension and use `vscode.debug.startDebugging(...)` to launch named configs and compound configs and in-memory launch configs. They should work identically to manually launching: changes in files and launch.configs will be saved, `preLaunchTasks` should be run.

Verify that `vscode.debug.startDebugging(...)` honours the folder argument.

Verify that `activeDebugSession`, `onDidStartDebugSession`, `onDidTerminateDebugSession`, and `onDidChangeActiveDebugSession` work as documented.

data.title: Output window grabbing focus extremely frustrating
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
xml|Dot|1.9.2
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
Hg|jak|0.0.4
Angular2|joh|2.4.0
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
hg|mrc|1.1.4
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6
typescript-hero|rbb|1.3.0
stylelint|shi|0.28.0
autoimport|ste|1.2.2
JavaScriptSnippets|xab|1.4.1

---

Please refer to #15018 for reproduction steps.
This still happens (triggered by the Angular2 extension) and since the Output window is a tab along with "Problems" and "Terminal", which we use, it keeps hiding important information and is extremely distracting and prevents me from working.

Can't we have a setting somewhere to just disable the output window? Or at least prevent it from grabbing focus and becoming visible over the other tabs? I don't really care about the never-ending error/log messages from some badly written extension. If need be, I'll go and re-enable the output window when I want to have a look at it.

The fact that the extension generate error message/verbose logs is one thing, but not what I expect you to fix. The fact that VSCode does not prevent these verbose logs from showing up is what I have trouble with here.

Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Generalize `TextEditor`-related APIs
data.body:
As far as I know there is no API for working with "non-text editors", for instance if we open an unsupported binary file it would be useful to be able to get it's path, so that we can provide some "Open in %APP%" commands for it.

What do you think?

data.title: No tooltip on hover over a variable within closure and async function while debugging
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

0. `git clone https://github.com/Deilan/vscode-issue-31469.git`.
1. `yarn install` or `npm install`.
2. Set debug breakpoint in `src/index.ts` at lines 10 and 19
3. Launch debug configuration `Launch via nodemon`.
4. Wait till breakpoint at line 10 hits.
5. Hover over `syncBeforeDelayArg` at line 5 and 6 - tooltip exists.
   Hover over `syncDelayResult` at line 7 - tooltip exists.
   Hover over `syncAfterDelayArg` at line 8 - tooltip exists.
   **Hover over `syncBeforeDelayArg` at line 9 - tooltip does not exist.**
   Hover over `syncDelayResult` at line 9 - tooltip exists.
   Hover over `syncAfterDelayArg` at line 9 - tooltip exists.
   **No `syncBeforeDelayArg` at debug sidebar's local variables list.**
6. Continue and wait till breakpoint at line 19 hits.
7. **Hover over `asyncBeforeDelayArg` at line 15 and 16 - tooltip does not exist.**
   **Hover over `asyncDelayResult` at line 16 - tooltip does not exist.**
   **Hover over `asyncAfterDelayArg` at line 17 - tooltip does not exist.**
   **Hover over `asyncBeforeDelayArg` at line 19 - tooltip does not exist.**
   **Hover over `asyncDelayResult` at line 19 - tooltip does not exist.**
   **Hover over `asyncAfterDelayArg` at line 19 - tooltip does not exist.**

Reproduces without extensions: Yes.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4777512/28635841-b4a89b30-7244-11e7-85fa-a1a63103cf69.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4777512/28635847-b864638a-7244-11e7-8fda-60aac0aaae92.png)

data.title: Incorrectly flag property "cwd" as not allowed for node attach in launch.json.

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add configuration to launch.json for node attach
2. Type "cwd" as property.

VSCode would say "Property cwd is not allowed".  Actually, the property is required for node attach to work properly with Meteor 1.6-beta.  Without it, break points would not be recognized.  The property should be allowed and intellisense should offer it.

data.title: After installing Ubuntu-WSL on Windows, the [VSCode] keyboad is no longer working properly
data.body:
I asked the question here at  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. with no comments or responses


<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise/10.0.14393 Build 14393

Steps to Reproduce:

I installed Ubuntu on Windows (WSL) and now my [VSCode] keyboard no longer works correctly.

vsCode no longer allows me it insert/copy/delete lines on a text or javascript files and I'm wondering if anyone has experienced the same.

I had to move back to sublime to edit my react apps because vsCode no longer allows me to edit my files or makes it VERY difficult to make changes I don't know how to debug something like this.//

I can reproduce it every time I edit a file and try to a. select a word/line to delete and IT IS NOT deleted.
I can't insert.

Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. 

I'm in the process of doing just that: renaming the .vscode windows folder and testing. however, I have over 75 extensions installed and it's going to be a **PITA** to have to add each extension to test

so far I identified all of the extensions I installed in July

1.  `esbenp.prettier-vscode-0.21.0`
2.  `davidhouchin.whitespace-plus-0.0.5`
3.  `leizongmin.node-module-intellisense-1.4.0`
4.  `vscodevim.vim-0.9.0`
5.  `dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.2.11`
6.  `PeterJausovec.vscode-docker-0.0.16`
7.  `ivanzusko.theme-chrome-devtools-dark-0.0.1`
8.  `azemoh.theme-onedark-0.5.2`
9.  `joshpeng.theme-charcoal-oceanicnext-1.1.5`
**10.** `ms-vscode.vs-keybindings-0.1.7`** 
11. `WallabyJs.wallaby-vscode-1.0.55`

number **10** seems like a likely suspect and I'll be working to see if that is where the trouble is and report back.

is there a way to trouble shoot this inside vscode, listing all of your enabled extensions & disabled extensions side by side?

any help will be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Visual Studio Code's Terminal allows click in URL but truncates its string if comma is found

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions:

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-css-formatter|aes|0.0.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a free account at https://darksky.net/dev/ and copy your API Key
2. Install node, open VS Code, open a folder for your node project 
3. Show your terminal ( CTRL + ' ) bash.exe in VS Code
4. In temrinal run npm init to initialize package.json and node_modules folder
5. Still in your project folder create a app.js with the statement and save the file: console.log('https://api.darksky.net/forecast/YOURAPIKEY/-23.5567497,-46.6541193');
6. Run the app in terminal: node app.js
7. On Terminal your app will print the URL
8. try to click the url displayed in Terminal
9. Terminal (bash.exe) will open your browser and take you to a truncated URL:
https://api.darksky.net/forecast/YOURAPIKEY/-23.5567497
10. The trailing part of URL ',-46.6541193' is being ignored!

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No - Doesn't matter

data.title: Suggestion: 1-click enable of settings in release notes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
A lot of times in release notes there's a new setting that can be enabled for the new feature.

Would be cool and easier to have a button that is clickable in the release notes that adds the needed setting to enable the feature, so can quickly enable the feature in one click without having to do multiple steps of editing the user settings config manually.

data.title: Test colour picker
data.body:
Test for #28587

- [x] windows - @weinand
- [x] macOS - @isidorn 
- [x] linux - @jrieken 

**Complexity**: 3

Hover over any color definition in CSS files to see the color picker.

**Test:**
- Behaviour of picker is as expected.
- Changing color modes works as expected (done through clicking on the header). 
- Color mode goes to transparent (e.g. to RGBA) if opacity slider is not at the top. And goes back to opaque (e.g. RGB), when no opacity is set. 
- If color mode is in format that doesn't support opacity and color mode change triggered, it should fall back to the next format that supports opacity.

Please raise most important issues first to jump faster on fixing them. No need for API tests in this milestone.

_Apologise for the delay._

data.title: Emmet completion for HTML cannot be disabled, works poorly with text.
data.body:
Let me begin with a general description of my problem. I'm writing a book that uses HTML as the base format. I'll type something like so:

My name is Ray. And when I hit the period for the end of the sentence, Emmet tries to autocomplete it. Since I'm hitting enter to add a newline for the closing paragraph tag, this ends up converting it to something like . I tried disabling the 'auto complete on enter' setting, but that messed with my snippets and muscle memory. Frankly, I just don't want to use Emmet. So I added HTML to emmet.excludeLanguage, but it still fires off in my HTML doc. - VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (fed03b66ac8acdac93897727a1d19ee0f6898bf2, 2017-07-25T07:30:52.414Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.16232 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 wordcount|ms-|0.1.0 --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add "html" to emmet.excludeLanguages 2. Notice that emmet still tries to work in HTML pages. Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

  "extends": "airbnb",
  "rules": {
    "max-len": [1, 100, 2, {ignoreComments: true}],
    "quote-props": [1, "consistent-as-needed"],
    "no-unused-vars": [2, {"args": "none"}],
    "radix": 0,
    "func-names": ["error", "never"],
    "linebreak-style": [
      "error",
      "unix"
    ],
  },
  "env": {
    "browser": true,
    "node": true,
    "es6": true
  },
  "plugins": [
    "react",
    "jsx-a11y",
    "import"
  ],
  "settings": {
    "import/resolver": {
      "webpack": {
        "config": "webpack.config.js"
      }
    }
  },
  "globals": {
    "_": true
  },
};

Can't understand why this error happens!

data.title: Remapped f4 to 5, and shift-f4 to % in Ubuntu. VS Code doesn't recognize it and opens a "search/repalce" dialog.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:16:25.899Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.8-040408-generic
- Extensions: the listing exceeds the lower minimum of browsers' URL characters limit
---
I spilled coffee on my keyboard and some of my keys aren't working. I remapped them to function keys. I changed `/usr/share/X11/xkb/symbols/us`  and added:

        key <FK04> {	[	  5,	percent		]	};

I logged out and logged in again and now F4 works as my 5 everywhere. I have tried it in gnome-terminal, vim, gvim, emacs, chrome etc. But VS Code doesn't respect it and opens the "search/replace" dialogue when I press it. 

I have tried it in vs code with all extensions disabled(`code --disable-extensions`) and it didn't work. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Remap f4 to 5 as described above. Log out and log in again. f4 should be 5 everywhere.

2. Open vs code and press f4. It opens "search/replace".

data.title: Suggestion: Show project README when opening a project
data.body: When I open a project in VS Code, I get presented with the Welcome screen. While that screen is nice, I believe it would be even more valuable to present the project's README (or README.md or .txt, whichever is present) in that same screen or even instead of that screen. This way, when you open VS Code without any open project you would be presented with the Welcome screen as it currently is, whereas if you open a project the README would be shown prominently (possibly with some of the shortcuts of the Welcome screen still on the right-hand side or something similar).

data.title: cant find \r in regex mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider ae73f8ee6f8ddb87b5e30d31655d9f55a53f4a95
Stable: cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e 1.14.2

Steps to Reproduce:
select CRLF for line end sequence
write some lines
abc\r\n
def

ctrl + f to open search
select regex mode (.*)
try `\n` (is selected)
try `\r` prints alternative fact no results.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes, tested Insiders only.
